definition: Preparedness averts peril./to be prepared, just in case (idiom)
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
variant of 備|备[bei4]
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to suffer (from illness)/to contract (a disease)/misfortune/trouble/danger/worry

sentences.english: Buy gum in family-sized 10-packs so you're always prepared.
sentences.chinese: 买十包装的家庭号口香糖，你就可以有备无患了。

sentences.english: No matter what the weather you will be prepared.
sentences.chinese: 无论天气怎样，你都有备无患。

sentences.english: All in all, being prepared ahead of time to prepare.
sentences.chinese: 总之是提前准备有备无患。

sentences.english: At this time, you should come to a "danger".
sentences.chinese: 这时，你应当来一个“有备无患”。

sentences.english: But it pays to plan ahead, just in case the politicians lose the last of their marbles.
sentences.chinese: 但是提前计划有备无患，难说政客们不会拼死一搏。

sentences.english: The kitchen is met with electric equipment increasing, establish electrical outlet more switch precautions averts perils.
sentences.chinese: 厨房用电器会越来越多，多设插座开关有备无患。

sentences.english: Taurean people tend to be slow, methodical, practical, and reserved.
sentences.chinese: 他们做事缓慢，有条不紊，讲究实际与有备无患。

definition: a possible period of want or need
see 防患未然[fang2 huan4 wei4 ran2]
lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
to prevent troubles before the event (idiom)/to forestall/to nip sth in the bud
surefire; absolutely safe (idiom)
know yourself, know your enemy (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
know yourself and know your enemy, and you will never be defeated (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
pinyin: zhi1 ji3 zhi1 bi3 , bai3 zhan4 bu4 dai4

definition: to come unscathed through a hundred battles (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3]); to win every fight
absolutely safe/surefire/thorough
Wanquan county in Zhangjiakou 張家口|张家口[Zhang1 jia1 kou3], Hebei
to put to good use/to come in handy
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
to save one's life/to survive
counter soldiers with arms, water with an earth weir (idiom); different situations call for different action/to adopt measures appropriate to the actual situation
pinyin: bing1 lai2 jiang4 dang3 , shui3 lai2 tu3 yan3

definition: self-protection/to defend oneself
to know the enemy and know oneself (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War")
when things come to a head (idiom)
